horse's hoofs approaching at a trot along the line of hussars was heard, and out of the foggy darkness the figure of a sergeant of hussars suddenly ap- peared, looming huge as an elephant. 
"Your honor, the generals I "said the sergeant, riding up to Rost6v. 
Rostov, still looking round toward the fires and the shouts, rode with the sergeant to meet some mounted men who were riding along the line. One was on a white horse. Prince Bagra- ti6n and Prince Dolgorukov with their adju- tants had come
